channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Migrants to UK will not get benefits until becoming citizens under new plans
item.description: Refugee Council says plans would create ‘expensive bureaucracy’ and keep people in limbo UK politics live –latest updates People who migrate to the UK...

item.title: Home secretary unveils plan to create the ‘most controlled and selective’ system in Europe for permanent migration – UK politics live
item.description: Shabana Mahmood reveals plan to revise rules on legal migration, including a wait of more than 10 years for settlement for migrants on benefits In an ...

item.title: Epstein survivors urge justice department to ‘do the right thing’ and release complete files – US politics live
item.description: Several survivors of late sex offender’s abuse urge department to ‘not withhold information’ as ongoing probes at Trump’s behest could limit what is r...

item.title: Cop30 live: current climate pathway ‘a death sentence for many’, says UN secretary-general
item.description: António Guterres uses speech at Belem summit to urge countries to find compromises in final hours of negotiations Inside the halls of Cop30 you see pe...

item.title: ‘Peace plans cannot work if Europe and Ukraine do not agree’ says EU in response to draft US-Russian proposal – Europe live
item.description: The draft plan, reportedly developed by Trump envoy Steve Witkoff and Kremlin adviser Kirill Dmitriev, would force draconian measures on Ukraine In th...

item.title: I need to earn right to be world champion - Wardley
item.description: Fabio Wardley says he still needs to "earn the right" to call himself world heavyweight champion and believes he "has a point to prove" to fans.

item.title: Burnham refuses to rule out challenging Starmer for leadership
item.description: Burnham says he is focused on his current role as Manchester mayor but could not say what the future holds.

item.title: Almost one million young people still not in work or education, figures show
item.description: Whilst the figure has dropped slightly, it still equates to one-in-eight young people in the UK, according to the Office for National Statistics.

item.title: Trans people could be barred from services based on appearance
item.description: The new code of practice on access to single-sex services cannot gain legal force until it gets sign-off from ministers.

item.title: Some migrants to face 20 year wait for settled status
item.description: Shabana Mahmood says becoming part of the UK is "not a right but a privilege – and one that must be earned".
